desc.p: Fields CUR.ASS.ALSO to CUR.VAL.ALSO form a related multi value set. Standard T24 amount field.
A maximum of 18 characters may be entered.
Fields EOD.ASSET to EOD.VALUE form a related multi value set. Standard T24 rate field.
A maximum of 10 characters may be entered.
Fields CUR.ASS.ALSO to CUR.VAL.ALSO form a related multi value set. Standard T24 numeric field.
A maximum of 15 characters may be entered.
Must be the key to a valid entry on the SECURITY.MASTER file.
Fields EOD.ASS.ALSO to EOD.VAL.ALSO form a related multi value set. Standard T24 numeric field.
A maximum of 15 characters may be entered.
Must be the key to a valid entry on the SECURITY.MASTER file.
Fields EOD.ASSET to EOD.VALUE form a related multi value set. Standard T24 rate field.
A maximum of 10 characters may be entered.
Fields EOD.ASS.ALSO to EOD.VAL.ALSO form a related multi value set. Standard T24 numeric field.
A maximum of 2 characters may be entered.
Must be the key to a valid entry on the COUNTRY file.
Fields EOD.ASS.ALSO to EOD.VAL.ALSO form a related multi value set. Standard T24 amount field.
A maximum of 18 characters may be entered.
Standard T24 alphanumeric field.
A maximum of 18 characters may be entered.
Fields EOD.ASSET to EOD.VALUE form a related multi value set. Standard T24 amount field.
A maximum of 18 characters may be entered.

This field denotes a period of time that defines the end of a maturity band and is normally used in conjunction with the field MAT.START . In practise, the remaining life to maturity (in days) for the bond is calculated using the maturity date on the SECURITY.MASTER file. The result is then applied to the maturity band to determine whether or not the bond falls into this band. This field is used for Portfolio modelling and reporting/enquiry purposes.
Example :

16.1.1 MAT.START 0D (greater than/equal to 0 days) 17.1.1 MAT.END 6M (less than 6 months) 16.1.2 MAT.START 6M (greater than/equal to 6 months) 17.1.2 MAT.END 1Y (less than 1 year) 16.1.3 MAT.START 1Y (greater than/equal to 1 year) 17.1.3 MAT.END 3Y (less than 3 years) 16.1.4 MAT.START 3Y (greater than/equal to 3 years) 17.1.4 MAT.END 10Y (less than 10 years) 16.1.5 MAT.START 10Y (greater than/equal to 10 years) 17.1.5 MAT.END (as above i.e. infinity)
Optional Input
If the field is not entered portfolio modelling processing will not group bonds by maturity band
If this field is populated, bonds will be grouped by maturity bands for modelling and reporting purposes.
Fields EOD.ASSET to EOD.VALUE form a related multi value set. Standard T24 numeric field.
A maximum of 2 characters may be entered.
Must be the key to a valid entry on the COUNTRY file.
Fields CURR.ASSET to CURR.VALUE form a related multi value set. Standard T24 rate field.
A maximum of 10 characters may be entered.

This field denotes a period of time that defines the start of a maturity band and is normally used in conjunction with the field MAT.END . In practise, the remaining life to maturity (in days) for the bond is calculated using the maturity date on the SECURITY.MASTER file. The result is then applied to the maturity band to determine whether or not the bond falls into this band. This field is used for Portfolio modelling and reporting/enquiry purposes.
Example :

16.1.1 MAT.START 0D (greater than/equal to 0 days) 17.1.1 MAT.END 6M (less than 6 months) 16.1.2 MAT.START 6M (greater than/equal to 6 months) 17.1.2 MAT.END 1Y (less than 1 year) 16.1.3 MAT.START 1Y (greater than/equal to 1 year) 17.1.3 MAT.END 3Y (less than 3 years) 16.1.4 MAT.START 3Y (greater than/equal to 3 years) 17.1.4 MAT.END 10Y (less than 10 years) 16.1.5 MAT.START 10Y (greater than/equal to 10 years) 17.1.5 MAT.END (as above i.e. infinity)
Optional Input
If the field is not entered portfolio modelling processing will not group bonds by maturity band
If this field is populated, bonds will be grouped by maturity bands for modelling and reporting purposes.
The total value of all assets for the portfolio.

A maximum of 15 characters may be entered.

Fields CURR.ASSET to CURR.VALUE form a related multi value set. Standard T24 numeric field.
A maximum of 2 characters may be entered.
Must be the key to a valid entry on the COUNTRY file.
The percentage of the portfolio value for the condition type.
The value of the portfolio for the condition in the reference currency of the portfolio.
Name of the SC.PORT.CONDITION.TYPE.
Fields CUR.ASS.ALSO to CUR.VAL.ALSO form a related multi value set. Standard T24 numeric field.
A maximum of 5 characters may be entered.
Must be the key to a valid entry on the ASSET.TYPE file.
